comments.author: @Jixzl
comments.text:
Depends on the circumstances. Going against what you enjoy/usually do to do something you don't enjoy but will likely get more views/money than your usual material is selling out. For example, a rock group releasing a pop song. Or me making a video about PewDiePie just to see if I can actually get some views (when I usually just make mental health videos on my other channel). 

Your video about PewDiePie's earnings was in keeping with your other material and interests, so it was not selling out in my opinion.

comments.author: @TheYama1993
comments.text: I think it's a duel edged blade really, like I started for the fun, I liked keeping my clips and putting some music and a little editing was a good was for me to keep my clips and games, but as I did more I started getting comments and views and that quickly became more important than using my channel just as a place to save my own footage, the idea of people watching and enjoying what I did, was amazing and gave me more reason to do videos more than just clips, so I think it's one of them things you start it for the fun of it, but once you start getting views, comments and feedback, it becomes more about that, I guess it's the whole thing of us humans always after some kind recognition for what we do in life, been told its good, it's different to you enjoying your own content, people saying they like you footage or comms is a "ego" boost and it's makes you feel good and that's what it becomes about some form of self validation as a whole

comments.author: @JoeMode213
comments.text:
Providing misleading content would be considered a punishable crime. Beast you are completely view orientated and denying someone's criticism regarding this is stupid. I don't think it's wrong inherently, your channel after all, but trying to defend your honesty or innocence given the nature of your content is ridiculous.     
Don't get me wrong, I like you, but let's not kid ourselves, don't try and pretend that you're on herd for any other reason than views if that's your motive. Don't then proceed to tell the rest of us that we're the same. Not everyone produces videos for views, the fact is your just not watching those who don't. I think it's called a fait a complis, whatever it is.
